dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, so it says here, uh, "Heat up to 30 degrees is coming to Kazakhstan"? Thirty?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, so it says here, uh, Heat up to thirty degrees is coming to Kazakhstan? Thirty?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Read also: Heat up to 30 degrees is coming to Kazakhstan

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I saw that too! But that's like, you know, a broader outlook. Look at Astana, though. That's what's wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I saw that too! But that's like, you know, a broader outlook. Look at Astana, though. That's what's wild.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Astana? Isn't it just going to be... cold? Like always?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Astana? Isn't it just going to be... cold? Like always?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, mostly. But check out March 21st. It drops from like, eight to ten degrees down to one to three, with rain and snow.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, mostly. But check out March twenty first. It drops from like, eight to ten degrees down to one to three, with rain and snow.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: March 20: ...daytime: 8-10ÂC. March 21: Cloudy with occasional precipitation (rain and snow)... Temperature: 1-3ÂC both at night and during the day.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, but it's not just that! It's, uh, "ice slick and drifting snow." That's not just a chilly day, that's like, a whole event.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, but it's not just that! It's, uh, ice slick and drifting snow. That's not just a chilly day, that's like, a whole event.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: March 21: Cloudy with occasional precipitation (rain and snow), ice slick, and drifting snow.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: An event of staying inside, I guess.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: An event of staying inside, I guess.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But think about, like, commuting. Or anyone who needs to travel. And the wind! Gusts up to twenty meters per second?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But think about, like, commuting. Or anyone who needs to travel. And the wind! Gusts up to twenty meters per second?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Southwesterly wind shifting to northwesterly at 9-14 m/s, with gusts up to 15-20 m/s during the day.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Twenty meters per second. Right. So, breezy. What about Almaty, does that get interesting?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Twenty meters per second. Right. So, breezy. What about Almaty, does that get interesting?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Almaty is completely different, though! March 19th, it's twenty to twenty-two degrees. That's, um, practically spring.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Almaty is completely different, though! March nineteenth, it's twenty to twenty-two degrees. That's, um, practically spring.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: March 19: Partly cloudy, no precipitation. Southeasterly wind at 3-8 m/s. Nighttime temperature: 5-7ÂC, daytime: 20-22ÂC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So one place is freezing, the other is kinda warm. What's the big deal? It's a huge country.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So one place is freezing, the other is kinda warm. What's the big deal? It's a huge country.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But you can't just ignore these contrasts! People need to know whether to pack a parka or, like, a light jacket for their trip.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But you can't just ignore these contrasts! People need to know whether to pack a parka or, like, a light jacket for their trip.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Or just, you know, look out the window.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Or just, you know, look out the window.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, but it's about preparation! Imagine planning a whole day out only to hit drifting snow and ice unexpectedly. It matters, um, for safety.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, but it's about preparation! Imagine planning a whole day out only to hit drifting snow and ice unexpectedly. It matters, um, for safety.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right, safety from, uh, slightly inconvenient weather.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, safety from, uh, slightly inconvenient weather.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's more than slightly inconvenient when you're dealing with ice slick on the roads! That's what Kazhydromet is telling us.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's more than slightly inconvenient when you're dealing with ice slick on the roads! That's what Kazhydromet is telling us.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: March 21: Cloudy with occasional precipitation (rain and snow), ice slick, and drifting snow.
